title: Accessing a URL without webapps returns 200 OK instead of 404
description: When starting a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed, accessing a URL results in a 200 OK response with no content, which is incorrect.
OB: When accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed, it returns an HTTP code of 200 OK with no content.
EB: When accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed, it should return an HTTP error 404, indicating that the requested resource is not found.
SR:
1. Download the Tomcat 7 instance from http://mirror.veriportal.com/apache/tomcat/tomcat7/v7.0.0beta/bin/apachetomcat7.0.0.zip.
2. Start the Tomcat 7 instance without deploying any webapps on it.
3. Access a URL on the Tomcat instance using a web browser or a tool.
4. Observe that it returns an HTTP code of 200 OK with no content, instead of the expected HTTP error 404.
